register.description: This register follows the format described in PDR3.5

bitfield.description: The scheme of the register used. Currently this is PDR 3.5 Scheme
The funcition of the module being used. The value is for vpe0_vayu_vpdma.
RTL Release Version The PDR release number of this IP. After Bootup this value becomes the firmware Revision ID
Major Release Number
This bit will be 1 when the VPDMA state machines image and data image have successfuly been fetched and loaded.
After bootup this bit states how DMA transaction are setup by lists or through register access.
Minor Release Number

register.description: The location of a new list to begin processing.

bitfield.description: Location of a new list of descriptors. This register must be written with the VPDMA Configuration Location after reset.

register.description: The attributes of a new list. This register should always be written after list_addr.

bitfield.description: The list number that should be assigned to the list located at LIST_ADDR. If the list is still active this will block all future list writes until the list is available.

This bit is written with the LIST_NUMBER field to stop a self-modifying list. When this bit is written a one the list specified by the LIST_NUMBER is sent a stop signal and will finish the current frame of transfers and then free the list resources.

This bit is low when a new list cannot be written to theVPE_LIST_ADDR register. The reasons this bit would be low are at initial startup if the LIST_MANAGER State Machine image has not completed loading. It also would be low if the last write to the LIST_ATTR attempted to start a list that is currently active. When this bit is low any writes to the list address register will cause access to not be accepted until this bit has set by the previous list having completed.
The type of list that has been generated.

bitenum.description: List Doorbell Others Reserved for future use

bitfield.description: Number of 128 bit word in the new list of descriptors. Writes to this register will activate the list in the list stack of the list manager and begin transfer of the list into VPDMA. This size can not be 0.

register.description: The register is used for processor to List Manager syncronization and status registers for the list.

bitfield.description: The list 7 is currently running. Any attempt to load a new list to list 7 will result in the LM_ADDR and LM_ATTR registers to be locked until the list is complete and this value goes to 0.
The list 6 is currently running. Any attempt to load a new list to list 6 will result in the LM_ADDR and LM_ATTR registers to be locked until the list is complete and this value goes to 0.
The list 5 is currently running. Any attempt to load a new list to list 5 will result in the LM_ADDR and LM_ATTR registers to be locked until the list is complete and this value goes to 0.
The list 4 is currently running. Any attempt to load a new list to list 4 will result in the LM_ADDR and LM_ATTR registers to be locked until the list is complete and this value goes to 0.
The list 3 is currently running. Any attempt to load a new list to list 3 will result in the LM_ADDR and LM_ATTR registers to be locked until the list is complete and this value goes to 0.
The list 2 is currently running. Any attempt to load a new list to list 2 will result in the LM_ADDR and LM_ATTR registers to be locked until the list is complete and this value goes to 0.
The list 1 is currently running. Any attempt to load a new list to list 1 will result in the LM_ADDR and LM_ATTR registers to be locked until the list is complete and this value goes to 0.
The list 0 is currently running. Any attempt to load a new list to list 0 will result in the LM_ADDR and LM_ATTR registers to be locked until the list is complete and this value goes to 0.
Writing a 1 to this field causes a sync event to fire that clears a Control Descriptor in List 7 waiting on it.
Writing a 1 to this field causes a sync event to fire that clears a Control Descriptor in List 6 waiting on it.
Writing a 1 to this field causes a sync event to fire that clears a Control Descriptor in List 5 waiting on it.
Writing a 1 to this field causes a sync event to fire that clears a Control Descriptor in List 4 waiting on it.
Writing a 1 to this field causes a sync event to fire that clears a Control Descriptor in List 3 waiting on it.
Writing a 1 to this field causes a sync event to fire that clears a Control Descriptor in List 2 waiting on it.
Writing a 1 to this field causes a sync event to fire that clears a Control Descriptor in List 1 waiting on it.
Writing a 1 to this field causes a sync event to fire that clears a Control Descriptor in List 0 waiting on it.

register.description: The registers used to set the background color for RGB

bitfield.description: The red value to give on an RGB data port for a blank pixel when using virtual video buffering
The green value to give on an RGB data port for a blank pixel when using virtual video buffering
The blue value to give on an RGB data port for a blank pixel when using virtual video buffering

register.description: Configures global parameters that are shared by all clients.

bitfield.description: Use Secondary Channels for Mosaic mode

register.description: Configures maximum width and maximum height global parameters that are shared by all clients to allow for configurable max width and max height when setting is 1 in write descriptor.

bitfield.description: The maximum width to use for setting of max_width 1 in a write descriptor. The value is the number of pixels + 1 so if 1024 pixels are required then set the value to 1023.
The maximum height to use for setting of max_height 1 in a write descriptor. The value is the number of lines + 1 so if 1024 lines are required then set the value to 1023.

register.description: Configures maximum width and maximum height global parameters that are shared by all clients to allow for configurable max width and max height when setting is 2 in write descriptor.

bitfield.description: The maximum width to use for setting of max_width 2 in a write descriptor. The value is the number of pixels + 1 so if 1024 pixels are required then set the value to 1023.
The maximum height to use for setting of max_height 2 in a write descriptor. The value is the number of lines + 1 so if 1024 lines are required then set the value to 1023.

register.description: Configures maximum width and maximum height global parameters that are shared by all clients to allow for configurable max width and max height when setting is 3 in write descriptor.

register.description: This register gives the information of the interrupts that have triggered since last cleared by the process that is servicing vpdma_int0.

bitfield.description: The last read DMA transaction has occurred for channel grpx3 and the channel is free to be updated for the next transfer. This will fire before the destination has received the data as it will have just been stored in the internal buffer. The client grpx3_data will now accept a new descriptor from the List Manager. This event will cause a one to be set in this register until cleared by software. Write a 1 to this field to clear the value.

The last read DMA transaction has occurred for channel grpx2 and the channel is free to be updated for the next transfer. register.description: The register holds status information and control for the client.

bitfield.description: The minimum number of clock cycles between requests being issued. This value is multiplied by 32 to get the actual number of cycles..This value is only accurate for the current frame. The internal counters used to calculate the rate are reset when a new frame begins and the first request of a frame will go as soon as possible.

The number of clock cycles between the last two requests issued. This value is multiplied by 32 to get the actual number of cycles.This value is only accurate for the current frame. The internal counters used to calculate the rate are reset when a new frame begins.
Signals if the client is currently active. This bit is set as soon as we the channel is received by the client from the list manager and is cleared when the channel is cleared from the shared memory.
Signals if the client is currently actively sending DMA requests
The source of the start frame event for the client.
Selects the output mode of the line buffer.

bitenum.description: repeat lines twice each output data line gets 2 times the number of frame lines.
each line once with Line Buffer Disabled, so no mirroring. Each line gets frame lines with identical data.

Each line seen once Mirroring is enabled so the top lines get the top lines repeated at the top of the frame and the bottom lines have the bottom lines repeated. Each line of data gets frame lines + number of buffered lines.
each line once only on one line. Each data line gets number of frame lines divided by number of buffered lines.

register.description: The register holds status information and control for the client.

bitfield.description: The minimum number of clock cycles between requests being issued. This value is multiplied by 32 to get the actual number of cycles..This value is only accurate for the current frame. The internal counters used to calculate the rate are reset when a new frame begins and the first request of a frame will go as soon as possible.

The number of clock cycles between the last two requests issued. This value is multiplied by 32 to get the actual number of cycles.This value is only accurate for the current frame. The internal counters used to calculate the rate are reset when a new frame begins.
Signals if the client is currently active. This bit is set as soon as we the channel is received by the client from the list manager and is cleared when the channel is cleared from the shared memory.
Signals if the client is currently actively sending DMA requests
The source of the start frame event for the client.
